data.title: Issues #1303 and #1337
data.body:
- Actual fix for issue #1303.
- Possible solution to issue #1337.

data.title: Fixed Live Wallpaper crash on Android 2.2
data.body:
Maybe not only on 2.2, but i have 2 "engines" on HTC Hero with 2.2.1 and have a crash because view is not initialized, because can't be initialized if have more than 1 engine (see line 331).
So, i think it's just a typo.

data.title: new3dapi: use CameraInputController for bullet tests
data.body:
Return true when activateKey is set, so other input processors arent processed.
Add CameraInputController to the bullet tests, which requires Ctrl to be clicked (can be changed to work on android when we have some sort of CameraGestureController).
Middle button (zoom) and right button (move) does work, but I didnt want to bloat the instructions so didnt notice them.

data.title: New3dapi: small changes
data.body:
Camera: 
set up vector when using lookAt and remove temp vector right.

Model: 
only set material attributes if they aren't null

ModelInstance: 
add calculateBoundingBox
reference instead of copy the specified matrix (useful for mvc, entity system, etc.)

CameraInputController:
class to easier control the camera (somewhat like the cam in modelling software), the default:
- Left button: rotate around a target vector, horizontal around Y axis, vertical around the right axis (recalculated to be perpendicular to the Y axis).
- Middle button: vertical: move the camera along the direction axis and translate the (rotation) target vector along with it (keeping the same distance).
- Scoll: move the camera along the direction axis, but not translate the (rotation) target vector.
- Right button: move the camera on the up/right plane and translate the (rotation) target vector also.

DefaultTextureBinder:
fix the max texture units (cannot bind more textures than GL_TEXTURE0+31)
only unbind textures that are bound

Mesh:
add calculateBoundingBox for a specific meshpart
add transformUV to translate/scale/rotate uv coordinates

Ray:
avoid creating objects

Change the tests accordingly

data.title: Update ParticleEmitterBox2D.java
data.body: The particleCollided check is just plain wrong and is making the whole particleemitter to react to the collisions happening instead of the single particle that collided.

data.title: New3dapi: Add ModelLoader
data.body:
Very basic abstract class that takes care of loading the textures and the implementation for .g3dj and .obj.
Also fix faces of meshbuilder for face culling.

data.title: Added getVolume to Music
data.body: It is showing that the entire file is changed after pushing to GitHub which was not the case.  Not sure why it is doing that.  Perhaps the CRLF across different platforms.

data.title: TMX Loader: Raise exceptions for unsupported formats
data.body:
Currently, a NullPointerException is thrown if the 'map/layer/data' tag has no 'encoding' attribute.
No 'encoding' attribute means that XML encoding is used, and this is not supported by the loader.
I also added a different exception for when there is an 'encoding' value that the loader does not recognise (for future encodings).
I also added a minor comment.

data.title: Issue #1376 Solution for ParticleEditor keyboard events handler.
data.body:
https://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=1376

Particle Editor doesn't handle key events after clicking on particle panel (lwjglCanvas).
Here is the simple solution.

data.title: New3dapi: Fix explosion, allow overwriting material attributes.
data.body:
- Add Material.Attribute#set(Attribute)
- Overwrite an attribute if it's added and the type already exists
- Fix explosion in invaders

data.title: fix issue 1326 (Android backend resumes audio too soon on phone unlock)
data.body:
Context:

https://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=1326

This is a pretty literal implementation of the fix suggested in the blog post. I have tested it on various Android versions and it works, but obviously I couldn't cover all the possible scenarios, so proceed with caution.

data.title: Change var name for easier migrate from lwjgl to jglfw
Changed default Gwt theme to edited Chrome theme with gwt-prefixed css classes only
data.body:
The edited theme no longer overwrites user defined css styles, if libgdx gwt module is embedded into premade web page.

see also https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/pull/288

data.title: write json without json.tojson(...)
Update Json.java
New3dapi, rename to .shaders.DefaultShader, move Light and add direction and angle
data.body:
- Use negative LightsCount to disable lighting (allowing zero lights)
- Rename TestShader to shaders.DefaultShader
- Move Light to .g3d and add direction and angle
- Default DefaultShader.ignoreUnimplemented to true for now

Let's not spend too much time on creating some uber default shader for now and indeed use TestShader for now.

data.title: New3dapi: Remove static TestShader.lightsCount
data.body:
Up until now we used a "hack" to enable/disable lighting. This PR better defines how lighting is enabled/disabled:

If Renderable#lights is null, lighting should be disabled for that renderable (think skyboxes etc.). TestShader#canRender now tests on this. GLES10Shader now simply enables/disables lighting if needed (could be optimized).

If Renderable#lights is an (empty) array (even if the items within that array are all null), lighting should be enabled for that renderable.

As for TestShader the maximum number of lights allowed is set by the ShaderProvider (which should be more than 0 for Renderable#light != null).

Still, the Light class some attention. We could also just add a Vector3 direction, float angle, etc. and call it a day for now.

data.title: New3dapi, various changes
data.body:
Some minor changes and doc updates. The biggest chage is the signature change of ModelBatch#render to allow multiple RenderableProviders to be specified at once.

All changes:
- Add Model#getManagedDisposables() (used by ModelBuilder)
- Check if a disposble is already in the array before adding it
- Set shader in ModelBatch#render instead of after the array is sorted
- Change render signature to allow multiple RenderableProviders at once
- Allow adding with only shader and no light, allow adding arrays.
- Update gdxinvaders and the tests with the above changes
- Remove ModelInstance#copyMaterials and instead copy only the materials actually used.
- Add ModelInstance instance to specify the IDs of the nodes to copy.
- Add BaseShaderProvider (which reuses and disposes shaders)
- Add ModelBuilder.rebuildReferences which recreates the arrays (materials, meshes and meshparts) within a Model based on the nodes.
- Allow to add a Model as a Node with ModelBuilder (should probably clear the disposables in the source)
- Some other helper methods to ModelBuilder.

data.title: Add setPosition, getDuration and canSeek to Music
data.body:
Implemented for android and ios. Also updates the MusicTest.
It would be great if someone could make it work for the other backends.

data.title: Issue #815 EarClippingTriangulator
Issue 1357
data.body:
Fixed method getRow(float y) in class com.esotericsoftware.tablelayout.BaseTableLayout.java

Just replace break to continue and all works fine)

data.title: Issue #1355- Joint user data
data.body: This implements the ability for Box2D joints to have user data assigned to them.

data.title: New3dapi, remove old code, gles10 renderer, etc.
data.body:
Quite some changes, but all really simple:
- Renamed NewMaterial to Material
- Moved ObjLoader out of the .old. package
- Added GLES10Shader. While this works well for now, its just intended to migrate things easier.
- DefaultShaderProvider (and therefor ModelBatch) now works also on GLES1.x
- Updated all the tests to use the new 3d api. Note that i might have used some quick solutions, which arent the best solution.
- Commented out ShadowMappingTest and SoftMeshTest which probably need to be recreated.
- Add some convenience methods to the api (ModelInstance constructor by position e.g.)
- Updated gdxinvaders to use the new 3d api, note that the explosions didnt use indices, so i use a quick hack which doesnt look that well.
- Removed everything in the .old.\* package

The model-loaders project is still in there, but with errors.

data.title: New3dapi: Add Model.ManagedInstance, implement Disposable for Model, ModelInstance...
data.body:
- Make NewMaterial and Attribute implement Disposable
- Make Attribute.type public final
- Remove deprecated NewMaterial methods.
- Add Model.ManagedInstance
- Dispose materials on Model#dispose and ModelInstance#dispose
- Make Model keep track of its instances and dispose them if the model is disposed.

data.title: Update getMaxTextureUnits, add sphere and cone, add BasicShapeTest
data.body:
- getMaxTextureUnits returned zero at my Phone, changed (see: http://www.opengl.org/wiki/Textures_-_more)
- add sphere and cone to meshbuilder
- add basicshapestest to bullet tests

data.title: Add focused styles for TextField.
data.body:
I normally would just commit, but since this involves scene2d, I figured I'd give Nate a chance to look at it first.

I just added a background and font color for when the TextField is focused. I also fixed a bug where if a TextField was set to disabled, and it had text, but did not have a disabledFontColor, it would crash.

The ternary is a tad messy now, so it might be better to drop it into an if-else instead, which I will gladly do if we want to do that.

data.title: Make order of modifiers consistent
data.body: Minor edit.

data.title: Redesign ModelBuilder
data.body:
Move ModelBuilder to utils

 MeshPartBuilder: interface describing anything you can do to manipulate a meshpart (add vertex, index, box, etc).
MeshBuilder: implements MeshPartBuilder, allowing to create one or more mesh parts
ModelBuilder: reuses MeshBuilders for the same attributes (amongst multiple models), allow adding node and reusing parts. Subnoded to be implemented but should not be that hard.

data.title: New3dapi, various changes
data.body:
- Add model ctor
- Generate ids for newmaterial if none given at construction
- Very basic modelbuilder class, just a placeholder for a better one for now
- Use bits for VertexAttributes#Usage (please check impact)
- Fix bullets tests, commented SoftMeshTest (going to rewrite)
  The bullet test run now including lights. Will check the code for performance/readability when the new 3d api is final.
